column5: I regularly fish lakes around the Ignace, Ontario area in early June. I am curious as to the water levels this year. Can anyone point me in the right direction or give me a heads up as to what I can expect? I have had great water the past 4 years, but I have a feeling that the area did not get as much precipitation as in years past. Thanks for any help.

I fished this area extensivley last September. water levels were down 3 feet from when I was up in June. The area did not get much for snow so you can take it from there. The area needs rain badly, I was seeing rocks sticking up in Sep that I had never seen before in the last 20 years. Plan accordingly, good luck GF
Lake of the Woods water control board. NWO Fishing Bum

To all: Thank you very much for the information. I am a bit nervous. I have been fishing this area for about 7 years. The only year I did not do well, it was low water. Any advice on how to fish low water? I guess most of my hot spots will be too low this year. Is it as easy as moving farther out towards the deeper water?
